intro: Phyllanthus cyclanthera var. gracillimus, commonly known as the slender leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It has a low-growing habit with multiple stems and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in arid regions.
